intro: Nivenia stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-sheath nivenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences, and are usually greenish or reddish in color. Nivenia stenosiphon is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
